Detailed Description

BtLocalSettings is an interface class to the local Bluetooth Settings like local device name, visibility, pairability and so on. It implements an interface for querying and setting properties of the Bluetooth Stack.
Although the most BtSet... functions execute asynchronous in the Bluetooth Stack, the time they need to execute is very short. So all BtSet... functions have an additional parameter that controlls the way the function is executed. If the execute_synchron parameter in the BtSet... functions is set to TRUE, the function will block and the result of the operation is given back via the result code of the function. Setting the execute_synchron parameter to FALSE the result code of the function only indicates whether the Bluetooth Stack has accepted the operation or not. The result of the operation is returned through a message sent to this object.
The most times the approach to execute the offered BtSet.. functions synchronous will be better, because, as mentioned above, the operations only take very short time to execute and no progess indication (GUI feedback during the operation) is necessary. Also the implementation of applications that use these functions synchronous is quite easier.
Sometimes an application programmer may decide that he wants to get more control over the operation as the synchronous interface offers. In this case the work he has to do is a little more complex: First he has to derive his own class from BtLocalSettings. The second step is to overwrite the appropriate On... function(s) were he has to implement the reaction on the operation result that is part of the message sent to the owerwritten On... function(s). It is not necessary to call the On... functions of this class because the implementation of the On... functions is only a dummy implementation that does really nothing.
Important: If an operation is executed synchronous, no matter it it is an instance of this class or a class derived from this class, there will be no call to any On... message function (not necessary because the result of the operation matches the result of the called function).

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum BtLocalSettings::BtActiveRequest [protected]
 

Asynchronous request type enumeration.

BtActiveRequest is used to decide whether a received message was initiated by this object or not.

Enumerator:
BtArNone  No asynchronous request is currently running.
BtArSwitchState  TurnOn or TurnOff is currently running asynchronously.
BtArLocalName  SetLocalName is currently running asynchronously.
BtArDiscoverability  SetDiscoverableMode is currently running asynchronously.
BtArPairability  SetPairableMode is currently running asynchronously.
BtArConnectablity  SetConnectableMode is currently running asynchronously.
BtArProfileActivation

Member Function Documentation

BtResultCode BtLocalSettings::GetChipVersion (  BtChipVersion &  chip_version  )  const
 

Get version of the Bluetooth Hardware.

GetChipVersion queries the version of the Bluetooth Hardware. This operation can not be performed if the Bluetooth functionality is turned off.

Parameters:
chip_version A reference to a BtChipVersion where to store the version of the Bluetooth Hardware returned by the stack.
Returns:
BtOk: The execution of the operation has finished successfully and chip_version is valid.
BtError: The execution of the operation failed: Do not use chip_version and check stack state for further information

Get current connectability mode.

GetConnectableMode queries the mode of connectability of the local Bluetooth settings. This operation can be performed although the Bluetooth functionality is turned off.

Parameters:
connectable_mode A reference to a BtConnectableMode enumeration type where to store the mode of connectability.
Returns:
BtOk: The operation was successfully executed and the connectable_mode is valid.
BtError: The operation failed. Do not use the returned connectable_mode.

void BtLocalSettings::OnConnectableMode (  BtResultCode  result  )  [protected, virtual]
 

BtConnectabilityMessage message handler.

If a SetConnectableMode request is currently running in asynchronous mode or the connectablitiy has changed through an external event,.a message is sent to this function to indicate the progress of the ongoing operation respectively to indicate th chage of the connectablitiy.

Parameters:
result A BtResult indicating the result of the ongoing operation respectvely the change of the connectablitiy.
Returns:
TRUE: The message has been handled and no further handling of this message is necessary.
FALSE: The message has not been handled.

BOOLEAN BtLocalSettings::OnMessage (  const Message &  message  )  [protected, virtual]
 

General message handler.

Every message that is send to a dispatcher, is first sent to the OnMessage callback. This function can either handle the message or route the message forward to another function. This is done in this implementation. If the OnMessage function receives a message it checks if the message is valid for this object, then it routes it to one of the following callback functions. Otherwise the message is ignored and FALSE is returned.

Parameters:
message A reference to a Message or on of its subclasses, representing an event occured in the system.
Returns:
TRUE: The message has been handled and no further handling of this message is necessary.
FALSE: The message has not been handled.

Implements Dispatcher.

void BtLocalSettings::OnPairableMode (  BtResultCode  result  )  [protected, virtual]
 

BtPairabilityMessage message handler.

If a SetPairableMode request is currently running in asynchronous mode or the pairability has changed through an external event, a message is sent to this function to indicate the progress of the ongoing operation respectively to indicate the change of the pairability.

Parameters:
result A BtResult indicating the result of the ongoing operation respectvely the change of the pairability.
Returns:

FALSE: The message has not been handled.

void BtLocalSettings::OnStateChange (  BtStackState  stack_state  )  [protected, virtual]
 

BtStateChangeMessage message handler.

If a TurnOn or TurnOff request is currently running in asynchronous mode or the state of the stack changed through an external event, a message is sent to this function to indicate a change in the stacks state

Parameters:
stack_state A BtStackState enumeration type containing the state to which the stack switched.
Returns:
TRUE: The message has been handled and no further handling of this message is necessary.
FALSE: The message has not been handled.

BtResultCode BtLocalSettings::SetConnectableMode (  BtConnectableMode  connectable_mode = BtCmConnectable,
BOOLEAN  execute_synchron = FALSE
) 
 

Set current connectability mode.

SetConnectableMode sets the mode of connectability of the local Bluetooth settings. This operation can be perform although the Bluetooth functionality is turned off. If the parameter execute_synchron is set to FALSE the OnConnectableMode callback function is called to indicate the progress of the operation.

Parameters:
connectable_mode A BtConnectableMode enumeration type containing the mode of connectability.
execute_synchron A BOOLEAN indicating wether the operation should be executed synchronous or not.
Returns:
BtAccepted: The stack has accepted the operation and the execution is running (only possible if execute_synchron is FALSE).
BtRejected: The stack has rejected the operation because the parameters are not valid (only possible if execute_synchron is FALSE).
BtIgnored: The operation can not be executed due to another operation currently executed (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE).
BtOk: The execution of the operation has finished successfully (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE).
BtError: The execution of the operation failed. (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE): Check stack state for further information.

BtResultCode BtLocalSettings::SetDiscoverableMode (  BtDiscoverableMode  discoverable_mode = BtDmGeneralDiscoverable,
BOOLEAN  execute_synchron = FALSE
)

Returns:

BtRejected: The stack has rejected the operation because the parameters are not valid (only possible if execute_synchron is FALSE).
BtIgnored: The operation can not be executed due to another operation currently executed (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE).
BtOk: The execution of the operation has finished successfully (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE).

Set local Bluetooth name.

SetLocalName sets the local Bluetooth name. This operation can be performed although the Bluetooth functionality is turned off. If the parameter execute_synchron is set to FALSE the OnLocalName callback function is called to indicate the progress of the operation.

execute_synchron A BOOLEAN indicating wether the operation should be executed synchronous or not.
Returns:

BtRejected: The stack has rejected the operation because the parameters are not valid (only possible if execute_synchron is FALSE).
BtIgnored: The operation can not be executed due to another operation currently executed (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE).
BtOk: The execution of the operation has finished successfully (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE).
BtError: The execution of the operation failed. (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE): Check stack state for further information.

BtResultCode BtLocalSettings::TurnOff (  BOOLEAN  execute_synchron = FALSE  ) 
 

Turn Bluetooth functionality off.

TurnOff switches Bluetooth functionality off. This operation can be performed although the Bluetooth functionality is turned off. If the parameter execute_synchron is set to FALSE the OnStateChange callback function is called to indicate the progress of the operation.

Parameters:
execute_synchron A BOOLEAN indicating wether the operation should be executed synchronous or not.
Returns:
BtAccepted: The stack has accepted the operation and the execution is running (only possible if execute_synchron is FALSE).
BtRejected: The stack has rejected the operation because the parameters are not valid (only possible if execute_synchron is FALSE).
BtIgnored: The operation can not be executed due to another operation currently executed (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE).
BtOk: The execution of the operation has finished successfully (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE).
BtError: The execution of the operation failed. (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE): Check stack state for further information.

BtResultCode BtLocalSettings::TurnOn (  BOOLEAN  execute_synchron = FALSE  ) 
 

Turn Bluetooth functionality on.

TurnOn switches Bluetooth functionality on.This operation can be performed although the Bluetooth functionality is turned off. If the parameter execute_synchron is set to FALSE the OnStateChange callback function is called to indicate the progress of the operation.

Parameters:

Returns:

BtOk: The execution of the operation has finished successfully (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE).
BtError: The execution of the operation failed. (only possible if execute_synchron is TRUE): Check stack state for further information.
